programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The DNA of Murders
programme.desc: Three brutal cold cases remain unsolved for decades until advances in forensic technology bring investigators closer than ever to finding answers for the victims’ families and friends.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Is This a Pork Chop?
programme.desc: Chef Yesinia Melo of Jessy’s Clean Meals in Lawrence takes on Chef Jason Gentles of Sahel in Lowell in a spicy battle of the mill towns. Can Yesinia’s fresh cooking put the Jerk champion in his place? Or will Jason knock it out of the park?

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.sub-title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.sub-title: Stitch: Love Stories
programme.desc: Love is all around us when you take the time to look. Whether it’s a couple still falling in love, or a community organizer making sure every child has a birthday party, there are heartwarming stories all across this country.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: Serial Killers
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.sub-title: Ballin' in Baltimore: Angel Sets Sail with Maritime Mogul Bobby LaPin in Iconic Baltimore Harbor
programme.desc: Angel gets her sea legs with Maritime mogul, Captain Bobby LaPin. They sail Baltimore's iconic harbor, dive deep into the city's green initiatives, shuck oysters, and head out crabbing with the best seafarers Charm City has to offer.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Daring Escapes From Custody
programme.desc: A look at daring escapes from custody and the breakouts that take on many forms – yet always involve finding and exploiting the weakest parts of the system.

programme.title: Widowed At 19
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Two high school sweethearts had their love story cut too short.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.sub-title: Stitch: Service Beyond the Shift
programme.desc: Every day, people go above and beyond for their communities. After clocking out, they continue to lend a hand, like a former firefighter giving away his earnings and a veteran making sure others have a place to sleep.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Re-creating Street Food Salad vs. Meatless Mash-up
programme.desc: In the battle that could ruin their friendship, Chef Lexi Gawlak of Swine & Sons in Winter Park faces off with Chef Jes Tantalo of Redlight Redlight in Audubon Park. It's a tastebud brawl on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Solid Foundation
programme.desc: Can Chef Colton Colburn-Wood of Cosmica in Boston trip up Chef Erin Miller of Urban Hearth in Cambridge? Both chefs skillfully build simple to complex foundations. But who will correctly replicate and get theirs plated in time?

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.sub-title: Wait, What Happened?: Are Those Hitchhiking Spiders?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero is not at the zoo – but he does have some questions about wild animal stories to ask his Queen City contestants.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It!: Chef Mom Throws Down Against Chef Dad in Kids Menu Match-Up
programme.desc: Food truck father Jimmy Longoria is up against munchy meal mother Helen Markatos. Can these chefs elevate the kids menu? Or will their dishes send them to time out?

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.sub-title: What's On The Menu, Greenville? Brunch
programme.desc: Join us as we skip the line of Greenville's most sought after weekend eateries for brunch. We'll head to Southern Culture and enjoy music with our grits, check out the Bohemian's DIY Bloody Mary Bar, and round out the day with Biscuit Head and Hen Dough.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Serial Killer on F Street
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Verona- Tiny Yet Mighty
programme.desc: Ed and Day venture to Verona and explore “the spot that’s more than a dot.” The guys play pickleball, dine on BBQ, get creative with splatter paint, and finish the day with a brew.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: Baltimore Invests in the Next Generation
programme.desc: From ice hockey to lacrosse to tennis, Baltimore coaches help drive the next generation to find family, inspiration and pride through sports.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Super Rare Stolen Treasures
programme.desc: From a 300-year-old violin valued at $6 million, to thousands of rare books, thieves will go to wild, even dangerous, lengths to snatch up irreplaceable treasures. For investigators, it's a race against the clock to recover these priceless valuables.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Caving Into Fun In Lincoln, NE
programme.desc: Explore a historic cave with timeless messages on its walls. Savor every last crumb of a Cookie Monster waffle. Test your putt-putt skills on a hole designed to get the better of you.

programme.title: Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: "Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild," examines the lives impacted in the hours, days and months following the collapse, telling the stories of first responders, workers at the Port of Baltimore, business owners and employees, and the people living in nearby communities.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Midwest Holiday Delights to Make Seasons Bright
programme.desc: Celebrate some of the Midwest's holiday favorites. Where scotcheroos take center stage, snicker salads delight, and the pink stuff surprises the pallet.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Running on Empty & Finishing with Family
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation: Iron + Resin
programme.desc: A Pittsburgh blacksmith, and an acrylic pour-artist in Boston.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation Challenge: Glass Artists Blow Away Judges with Fire and Finesse
programme.desc: Three of Orlando’s finest glass artists take on the challenge of creating an original design celebrating "The City Beautiful," but will a bird-brained twist push them to their melting point, and who will emerge victorious?

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Riveting Recoveries of Stolen Items
programme.desc: From paying ransoms to scouring hand-drawn treasure maps, these theft victims will do anything to recover their precious property.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Don’t Cave Into The Pressure
programme.desc: Ivan Gomez is on a weight loss journey, but it’s one that’s been limited to exercising in his home. Kinga meets Ivan in Stockton, CA to show him how the outdoors can be a personal gym for body, mind and spirit.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.sub-title: The Spark: Makeup Queen
programme.desc: A’lores C. Norris finds inspiration and purpose in creating an inclusive space within the makeup industry. She shares her story of creating her makeup brand and a community of empowerment.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Kickin' Butt in Larimer
programme.desc: Ed and Day kick butt, ride dirty, and make artisanal cocktails at Goodlander Cocktail Brewery in the town of Larimer.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Re-creating Indian Butter Sauce Grooper vs. Woodfired Octopus
programme.desc: In this battle, it's a culinary inferno, as Chef Bruno Zacchini of Pizza Bruno in College Park & Curry Ford West takes on Chef Amanda Czekaj of Farm & Haus in Audubon Park. There's no escaping the heat on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Widowed At 19
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Two high school sweethearts had their love story cut too short.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: KC Sports Heroes Redefine What it Means to be Top of Your Game
programme.desc: From a dance instructor who prioritizes mental health for her students, to a high school baseball coach who exemplified courage, KC athletes show off their formulas for success.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.sub-title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: BBQ Boss, Lucky Boys, & Bra Pad Pioneer Share Best Hot Spots
programme.desc: Local Kansas City notables, including Beth Wiese and Lucky Boys, give us the inside scoop on where to go for chocolate-covered bananas and how to prepare to order at Gates Bar-B-Q. Thinking about getting a tattoo? We've got a rec for that too!

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Baltimore: Who Will Win the Battle of the Bay?
programme.desc: Chefs Sean Guy and Amy Hessel compete in this seafood showdown, the ultimate Battle of the Bay. Who will walk away with the title Captain of the Chesapeake?

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.sub-title: Ballin' in Baltimore: Baseball Legend Ryan Ripken Pitches Angel a Day of Iconic Institutions
programme.desc: Angel joins baseball legend, Ryan Ripken, for a home run day, exploring the best of Baltimore. They bat 100 at Ripken Stadium, learn about sea life at the National Aquarium, crush indoor rock climbing and show down in an epic cook-off.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Vanishing of a Promising Wisconsin Teen
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Beck’s death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.sub-title: Free Spirit : How Birmingham Bars Embrace Blue Collar Roots and a Multicultural Present
programme.desc: Birmingham’s favorite bartenders take Kate on a world tour of cocktails with tropical tiki showstoppers, aromatic Middle Eastern flavors, blue-collar dive bar favorites, and Kate’s first and truest love – agave spirits.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Running on Empty & Finishing with Family
programme.desc: Justin pushes body and mind through seven brutal marathons on seven continents in seven days. From frostbite in Antarctica to his daughter joining him for the final steps in Miami, this is the most intense and inspiring challenge of his life.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: A Gamer Plugs into the Outdoors
programme.desc: Maverick Meyers is a shy 17 year old gamer who spends 8 hours a day on his self-built computer. Kinga meets Maverick in Clermont, Florida to take him out of his comfort zone on an outing he’ll never forget.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.sub-title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: "Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild," examines the lives impacted in the hours, days and months following the collapse, telling the stories of first responders, workers at the Port of Baltimore, business owners and employees, and the people living in nearby communities.

programme.title: Rickwood: The Soul of Birmingham
programme.sub-title: Rickwood: The Soul of Birmingham
programme.desc: This is the story of the oldest professional ballpark in the U.S. and the determination of its home team, the Black Barons. The voice of Rickwood tells the tale of its pivotal role in The Negro League, Black history and its legacy in American sports.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.
